[[Sorry, got a bit messed up on the numbering there. But I think you get the point]]
13/13 Thatcher didn't tweet.
12/13 Thatcher was deeply suspicious of any attempts by the state to pick winners and losers. She believed in markets.
11/13 Thatcher remained married to the same man for her entire life. She did not commit adultery.
10/13Thatcher had immense respect for the intelligence community. She believed in the tools of traditional statecraft.
10/13 Thatcher had excellent command of English. She expressed herself clearly and concisely. She did not talk down to people.
9/13 Thatcher didn’t care about celebrity.
8/13 Thatcher was an avid reader. She took books and ideas extremely seriously.
7/13 Thatcher believed in free trade. She despised protectionism.
6/13 Thatcher was of modest middle-class origins. Her father owned two grocery stores.
5/13 Thatcher was intensely religious, but didn’t wear it on her sleeve. She didn’t use faith as a political tool.
4/13 Thatcher believed wholeheartedly in NATO (and its expansion). She would be aghast to see Trump questioning its value.
3/13 Thatcher didn’t give a damn about her popularity. She cared about doing what she thought was right.
2/13 Thatcher had a clear ideology to which she gave her passionate allegiance. She spent her entire political life as a Tory.
